meanings.definition: To incite or goad into action.
meanings.sent1: The coach igged the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speaker igged the audience to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel igged the dog into chasing it around the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her passionate speech igged a fire in their hearts to fight for justice.
meanings.sent5: The thunderous applause igged the performer to give an encore.

meanings.sent1: The surprise party igged her with joy and excitement.
meanings.sent2: The thrilling movie igged the audience's adrenaline.
meanings.sent3: The tantalizing aroma of freshly baked cookies igged his appetite.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious letter igged her curiosity to unravel its secrets.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the sunset igged a sense of wonder in the children.

meanings.sent1: The rumor igged unnecessary drama among the friends.
meanings.sent2: The controversial article igged a heated debate among the readers.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy igged the older dog to play chase in the park.
meanings.sent4: His rebellious attitude igged a revolution within the community.
meanings.sent5: The striking artwork igged a sense of creativity in the viewers.
